newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador postpones telecom specifications sale.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador postpones telecom specifications sale.

text.p: Ecuador has postponed the sale of tender specifications for the September privatization of telecommunications firm Emetel, a goverment official said Thursday.
The specifications, which were due to go on sale from May 19, should now be available later this month, Rodrigo Paz, president of the National Privatization Council, told Reuters.
U.S. firms MCI and GTE, Italy's Stet, Spain's Telefonica de Espana, and Korea Telecom presented documents to register for the tender in November.
Paz said the government had still not finished updating the valuation of Emetel, but it would announce a base price no later than 15 days before the tender.
